sessions.title: Restaurant
sessions.description: You went out to eat at a restaurant. The waiter comes to ask for your order.
prompts: Waiter: Greet the customer politely and ask for their order in one short sentence.

Waiter: If the customer gives you a valid order (for example: 'I’ll have a grilled salmon and a soup'), acknowledge the order briefly and always append <CONTINUE>. If you don't append <CONTINUE> the conversation will go on forever and this is not something you want. If the customer asks for menu details or information (for example: 'What do you have on the menu?', 'What is on your menu?', 'Can you tell me what you serve?'), provide a brief answer (1–2 short sentences) describing some menu items and end with <REPEAT>. If the input is unclear (nonsense, gibberish, incomplete), respond with exactly: 'Waiter: Sorry, could you repeat your order? <REPEAT>'. Your response is invalid unless it ends with one of these tokens: <REPEAT>, <CONTINUE>.
Waiter: Confirm the full order in one short sentence and mention it will be ready soon.
Waiter: Thank the customer politely and close the conversation in one short sentence.
